articles.title: Berberine derivative C51 modulates cGAS-STING-TIM-3 axis to reverse immune evasion and inhibit lung cancer growth.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative, C51, inhibits lung cancer growth by activating immune pathways and blocking cancer cells' ability to evade the immune system.

articles.title: Investigation of exercise-mimetic bioactive molecules as modulators of MMP activity and expression in cancer cells.
articles.summary: Exercise-mimetic molecules like Icariin and Berberine can potentially inhibit lung cancer cell growth by targeting and reducing matrix metalloproteinase activity.

articles.title: NK cell-mediated tumor cell killing by bispecific innate cell engagers induces ADCC-mediated activation of primary human dendritic cells.
articles.summary: Bispecific antibodies targeting NK cells trigger dendritic cell activation and enhanced T-cell priming, potentially improving anti-tumor immune responses.

articles.title: Gut microbiome remodeling induced by microplastic exposure in humans.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Microplastic exposure significantly alters human gut microbiome composition, potentially increasing risks of inflammatory conditions and certain diseases.

articles.title: The colloidal stability of albumin-based drug delivery systems has a profound effect on tumoricidal activity.
articles.summary: Researchers developed an improved HSA-PLA nanoparticle drug delivery system for paclitaxel that enhances colloidal stability and increases tumor drug exposure compared to Abraxane.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary: Manipulating gut bacteria diversity through fecal transplants, probiotics, and diet may improve immunotherapy response for urothelial carcinoma patients.

articles.title: Effects of estradiol, tamoxifen, and raloxifene on human temporal lobe cortex astroglial cell spreading.
articles.summary: Estradiol, tamoxifen, and raloxifene significantly impact how astrocyte cells spread and interact in the human temporal lobe cortex, potentially influencing brain cell communication.
